31/** @file
32 * Integrated TV-out support for the 915GM and 945GM.
33 */
34

47enum tv_margin {
48 TV_MARGIN_LEFT, TV_MARGIN_TOP,
49 TV_MARGIN_RIGHT, TV_MARGIN_BOTTOM
50};
51
52/** Private structure for the integrated TV support */
53struct intel_tv {
54 struct intel_encoder base;
55
56 int type;
57 const char *tv_format;
58 int margin[4];
59 u32 save_TV_H_CTL_1;
60 u32 save_TV_H_CTL_2;
61 u32 save_TV_H_CTL_3;
62 u32 save_TV_V_CTL_1;
63 u32 save_TV_V_CTL_2;
64 u32 save_TV_V_CTL_3;
65 u32 save_TV_V_CTL_4;
66 u32 save_TV_V_CTL_5;
67 u32 save_TV_V_CTL_6;
68 u32 save_TV_V_CTL_7;
69 u32 save_TV_SC_CTL_1, save_TV_SC_CTL_2, save_TV_SC_CTL_3;
70
71 u32 save_TV_CSC_Y;
72 u32 save_TV_CSC_Y2;
73 u32 save_TV_CSC_U;
74 u32 save_TV_CSC_U2;
75 u32 save_TV_CSC_V;
76 u32 save_TV_CSC_V2;
77 u32 save_TV_CLR_KNOBS;
78 u32 save_TV_CLR_LEVEL;
79 u32 save_TV_WIN_POS;
80 u32 save_TV_WIN_SIZE;
81 u32 save_TV_FILTER_CTL_1;
82 u32 save_TV_FILTER_CTL_2;
83 u32 save_TV_FILTER_CTL_3;
84
85 u32 save_TV_H_LUMA[60];
86 u32 save_TV_H_CHROMA[60];
87 u32 save_TV_V_LUMA[43];
88 u32 save_TV_V_CHROMA[43];
89
90 u32 save_TV_DAC;
91 u32 save_TV_CTL;
92};
93
94struct video_levels {
95 int blank, black, burst;
96};
97
98struct color_conversion {
99 u16 ry, gy, by, ay;
100 u16 ru, gu, bu, au;
101 u16 rv, gv, bv, av;
102};

159/*
160 * Color conversion values have 3 separate fixed point formats:
161 *
162 * 10 bit fields (ay, au)
163 * 1.9 fixed point (b.bbbbbbbbb)
164 * 11 bit fields (ry, by, ru, gu, gv)
165 * exp.mantissa (ee.mmmmmmmmm)
166 * ee = 00 = 10^-1 (0.mmmmmmmmm)
167 * ee = 01 = 10^-2 (0.0mmmmmmmmm)
168 * ee = 10 = 10^-3 (0.00mmmmmmmmm)
169 * ee = 11 = 10^-4 (0.000mmmmmmmmm)
170 * 12 bit fields (gy, rv, bu)
171 * exp.mantissa (eee.mmmmmmmmm)
172 * eee = 000 = 10^-1 (0.mmmmmmmmm)
173 * eee = 001 = 10^-2 (0.0mmmmmmmmm)
174 * eee = 010 = 10^-3 (0.00mmmmmmmmm)
175 * eee = 011 = 10^-4 (0.000mmmmmmmmm)
176 * eee = 100 = reserved
177 * eee = 101 = reserved
178 * eee = 110 = reserved
179 * eee = 111 = 10^0 (m.mmmmmmmm) (only usable for 1.0 representation)
180 *
181 * Saturation and contrast are 8 bits, with their own representation:
182 * 8 bit field (saturation, contrast)
183 * exp.mantissa (ee.mmmmmm)
184 * ee = 00 = 10^-1 (0.mmmmmm)
185 * ee = 01 = 10^0 (m.mmmmm)
186 * ee = 10 = 10^1 (mm.mmmm)
187 * ee = 11 = 10^2 (mmm.mmm)
188 *
189 * Simple conversion function:
190 *
191 * static u32
192 * float_to_csc_11(float f)
193 * {
194 * u32 exp;
195 * u32 mant;
196 * u32 ret;
197 *
198 * if (f < 0)
199 * f = -f;
200 *
201 * if (f >= 1) {
202 * exp = 0x7;
203 * mant = 1 << 8;
204 * } else {
205 * for (exp = 0; exp < 3 && f < 0.5; exp++)
206 * f *= 2.0;
207 * mant = (f * (1 << 9) + 0.5);
208 * if (mant >= (1 << 9))
209 * mant = (1 << 9) - 1;
210 * }
211 * ret = (exp << 9) | mant;
212 * return ret;
213 * }
214 */
215
216/*
217 * Behold, magic numbers! If we plant them they might grow a big
218 * s-video cable to the sky... or something.
219 *
220 * Pre-converted to appropriate hex value.
221 */
222

224 * PAL & NTSC values for composite & s-video connections
225 */

361
362struct tv_mode {
363 const char *name;
364 int clock;
365 int refresh; /* in millihertz (for precision) */
366 u32 oversample;
367 int hsync_end, hblank_start, hblank_end, htotal;
368 bool progressive, trilevel_sync, component_only;
369 int vsync_start_f1, vsync_start_f2, vsync_len;
370 bool veq_ena;
371 int veq_start_f1, veq_start_f2, veq_len;
372 int vi_end_f1, vi_end_f2, nbr_end;
373 bool burst_ena;
374 int hburst_start, hburst_len;
375 int vburst_start_f1, vburst_end_f1;
376 int vburst_start_f2, vburst_end_f2;
377 int vburst_start_f3, vburst_end_f3;
378 int vburst_start_f4, vburst_end_f4;
379 /*
380 * subcarrier programming
381 */
382 int dda2_size, dda3_size, dda1_inc, dda2_inc, dda3_inc;
383 u32 sc_reset;
384 bool pal_burst;
385 /*
386 * blank/black levels
387 */
388 const struct video_levels *composite_levels, *svideo_levels;
389 const struct color_conversion *composite_color, *svideo_color;
390 const u32 *filter_table;
391 int max_srcw;
392};
393
394
395/*
396 * Sub carrier DDA
397 *
398 * I think this works as follows:
399 *
400 * subcarrier freq = pixel_clock * (dda1_inc + dda2_inc / dda2_size) / 4096
401 *
402 * Presumably, when dda3 is added in, it gets to adjust the dda2_inc value
403 *
404 * So,
405 * dda1_ideal = subcarrier/pixel * 4096
406 * dda1_inc = floor (dda1_ideal)
407 * dda2 = dda1_ideal - dda1_inc
408 *
409 * then pick a ratio for dda2 that gives the closest approximation. If
410 * you can't get close enough, you can play with dda3 as well. This
411 * seems likely to happen when dda2 is small as the jumps would be larger
412 *
413 * To invert this,
414 *
415 * pixel_clock = subcarrier * 4096 / (dda1_inc + dda2_inc / dda2_size)
416 *
417 * The constants below were all computed using a 107.520MHz clock
418 */
419
420/**
421 * Register programming values for TV modes.
422 *
423 * These values account for -1s required.
424 */
425
426static const struct tv_mode tv_modes[] = {
427 {
428 .name = "NTSC-M",
429 .clock = 108000,
430 .refresh = 59940,
431 .oversample = TV_OVERSAMPLE_8X,
432 .component_only = 0,
433 /* 525 Lines, 60 Fields, 15.734KHz line, Sub-Carrier 3.580MHz */
434
435 .hsync_end = 64, .hblank_end = 124,
436 .hblank_start = 836, .htotal = 857,
437
438 .progressive = false, .trilevel_sync = false,
439
440 .vsync_start_f1 = 6, .vsync_start_f2 = 7,
441 .vsync_len = 6,

444 .veq_start_f2 = 1, .veq_len = 18,

836
837static struct intel_tv *enc_to_tv(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
838{
839 return container_of(encoder, struct intel_tv, base);
840}
841
842static struct intel_tv *intel_attached_tv(struct drm_connector *connector)
843{
844 return enc_to_tv(intel_attached_encoder(connector));
845}
846
847static bool
848intel_tv_get_hw_state(struct intel_encoder *encoder, enum i915_pipe *pipe)
849{
850 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
851 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
852 u32 tmp = I915_READ(TV_CTL);
853
854 if (!(tmp & TV_ENC_ENABLE))
855 return false;
856
857 *pipe = PORT_TO_PIPE(tmp);
858
859 return true;
860}
861
862static void
863intel_enable_tv(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
864{
865 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
866 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
867
868 /* Prevents vblank waits from timing out in intel_tv_detect_type() */
869 intel_wait_for_vblank(encoder->base.dev,
870 to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc)->pipe);
871
872 I915_WRITE(TV_CTL, I915_READ(TV_CTL) | TV_ENC_ENABLE);
873}
874
875static void
876intel_disable_tv(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
877{
878 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
879 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
880
881 I915_WRITE(TV_CTL, I915_READ(TV_CTL) & ~TV_ENC_ENABLE);
882}
883
884static const struct tv_mode *
885intel_tv_mode_lookup(const char *tv_format)
886{
887 int i;
888
889 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(tv_modes); i++) {
890 const struct tv_mode *tv_mode = &tv_modes[i];
891
892 if (!strcmp(tv_format, tv_mode->name))
893 return tv_mode;
894 }
895 return NULL;
896}
897
898static const struct tv_mode *
899intel_tv_mode_find(struct intel_tv *intel_tv)
900{
901 return intel_tv_mode_lookup(intel_tv->tv_format);
902}
903
904static enum drm_mode_status
905intel_tv_mode_valid(struct drm_connector *connector,
906 struct drm_display_mode *mode)
907{
908 struct intel_tv *intel_tv = intel_attached_tv(connector);
909 const struct tv_mode *tv_mode = intel_tv_mode_find(intel_tv);
910
911 /* Ensure TV refresh is close to desired refresh */
912 if (tv_mode && abs(tv_mode->refresh - drm_mode_vrefresh(mode) * 1000)
913 < 1000)
914 return MODE_OK;
915
916 return MODE_CLOCK_RANGE;
917}
918
919
920static void
921intel_tv_get_config(struct intel_encoder *encoder,
922 struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config)
923{
924 pipe_config->base.adjusted_mode.crtc_clock = pipe_config->port_clock;
925}
926
927static bool
928intel_tv_compute_config(struct intel_encoder *encoder,
929 struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config)
930{
931 struct intel_tv *intel_tv = enc_to_tv(encoder);
932 const struct tv_mode *tv_mode = intel_tv_mode_find(intel_tv);
933
934 if (!tv_mode)
935 return false;
936
937 pipe_config->base.adjusted_mode.crtc_clock = tv_mode->clock;
938 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("forcing bpc to 8 for TV\n");
939 pipe_config->pipe_bpp = 8*3;
940
941 /* TV has it's own notion of sync and other mode flags, so clear them. */
942 pipe_config->base.adjusted_mode.flags = 0;
943
944 /*
945 * FIXME: We don't check whether the input mode is actually what we want
946 * or whether userspace is doing something stupid.
947 */
948
949 return true;
950}
951
952static void
953set_tv_mode_timings(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
954 const struct tv_mode *tv_mode,
955 bool burst_ena)
956{
957 u32 hctl1, hctl2, hctl3;
958 u32 vctl1, vctl2, vctl3, vctl4, vctl5, vctl6, vctl7;
959
960 hctl1 = (tv_mode->hsync_end << TV_HSYNC_END_SHIFT) |
961 (tv_mode->htotal << TV_HTOTAL_SHIFT);
962
963 hctl2 = (tv_mode->hburst_start << 16) |
964 (tv_mode->hburst_len << TV_HBURST_LEN_SHIFT);
965
966 if (burst_ena)
967 hctl2 |= TV_BURST_ENA;
968
969 hctl3 = (tv_mode->hblank_start << TV_HBLANK_START_SHIFT) |
970 (tv_mode->hblank_end << TV_HBLANK_END_SHIFT);
971
972 vctl1 = (tv_mode->nbr_end << TV_NBR_END_SHIFT) |
973 (tv_mode->vi_end_f1 << TV_VI_END_F1_SHIFT) |
974 (tv_mode->vi_end_f2 << TV_VI_END_F2_SHIFT);
975
976 vctl2 = (tv_mode->vsync_len << TV_VSYNC_LEN_SHIFT) |
977 (tv_mode->vsync_start_f1 << TV_VSYNC_START_F1_SHIFT) |
978 (tv_mode->vsync_start_f2 << TV_VSYNC_START_F2_SHIFT);
979
980 vctl3 = (tv_mode->veq_len << TV_VEQ_LEN_SHIFT) |
981 (tv_mode->veq_start_f1 << TV_VEQ_START_F1_SHIFT) |
982 (tv_mode->veq_start_f2 << TV_VEQ_START_F2_SHIFT);
983
984 if (tv_mode->veq_ena)
985 vctl3 |= TV_EQUAL_ENA;
986
987 vctl4 = (tv_mode->vburst_start_f1 << TV_VBURST_START_F1_SHIFT) |
988 (tv_mode->vburst_end_f1 << TV_VBURST_END_F1_SHIFT);
989
990 vctl5 = (tv_mode->vburst_start_f2 << TV_VBURST_START_F2_SHIFT) |
991 (tv_mode->vburst_end_f2 << TV_VBURST_END_F2_SHIFT);
992
993 vctl6 = (tv_mode->vburst_start_f3 << TV_VBURST_START_F3_SHIFT) |
994 (tv_mode->vburst_end_f3 << TV_VBURST_END_F3_SHIFT);
995
996 vctl7 = (tv_mode->vburst_start_f4 << TV_VBURST_START_F4_SHIFT) |
997 (tv_mode->vburst_end_f4 << TV_VBURST_END_F4_SHIFT);
998
999 I915_WRITE(TV_H_CTL_1, hctl1);
1000 I915_WRITE(TV_H_CTL_2, hctl2);
1001 I915_WRITE(TV_H_CTL_3, hctl3);
1002 I915_WRITE(TV_V_CTL_1, vctl1);
1003 I915_WRITE(TV_V_CTL_2, vctl2);
1004 I915_WRITE(TV_V_CTL_3, vctl3);
1005 I915_WRITE(TV_V_CTL_4, vctl4);
1006 I915_WRITE(TV_V_CTL_5, vctl5);
1007 I915_WRITE(TV_V_CTL_6, vctl6);
1008 I915_WRITE(TV_V_CTL_7, vctl7);
1009}
1010
1011static void set_color_conversion(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
1012 const struct color_conversion *color_conversion)
1013{
1014 if (!color_conversion)
1015 return;
1016
1017 I915_WRITE(TV_CSC_Y, (color_conversion->ry << 16) |
1018 color_conversion->gy);
1019 I915_WRITE(TV_CSC_Y2, (color_conversion->by << 16) |
1020 color_conversion->ay);
1021 I915_WRITE(TV_CSC_U, (color_conversion->ru << 16) |
1022 color_conversion->gu);
1023 I915_WRITE(TV_CSC_U2, (color_conversion->bu << 16) |
1024 color_conversion->au);
1025 I915_WRITE(TV_CSC_V, (color_conversion->rv << 16) |
1026 color_conversion->gv);
1027 I915_WRITE(TV_CSC_V2, (color_conversion->bv << 16) |
1028 color_conversion->av);
1029}
1030
1031static void intel_tv_pre_enable(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1032{
1033 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
1034 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1035 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
1036 struct intel_tv *intel_tv = enc_to_tv(encoder);
1037 const struct tv_mode *tv_mode = intel_tv_mode_find(intel_tv);
1038 u32 tv_ctl;
1039 u32 scctl1, scctl2, scctl3;
1040 int i, j;
1041 const struct video_levels *video_levels;
1042 const struct color_conversion *color_conversion;
1043 bool burst_ena;
1044 int xpos = 0x0, ypos = 0x0;
1045 unsigned int xsize, ysize;
1046
1047 if (!tv_mode)
1048 return; /* can't happen (mode_prepare prevents this) */
1049
1050 tv_ctl = I915_READ(TV_CTL);
1051 tv_ctl &= TV_CTL_SAVE;
1052
1053 switch (intel_tv->type) {
1054 default:
1055 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_Unknown:
1056 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_Composite:
1057 tv_ctl |= TV_ENC_OUTPUT_COMPOSITE;
1058 video_levels = tv_mode->composite_levels;
1059 color_conversion = tv_mode->composite_color;
1060 burst_ena = tv_mode->burst_ena;
1061 break;
1062 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_Component:
1063 tv_ctl |= TV_ENC_OUTPUT_COMPONENT;
1064 video_levels = &component_levels;
1065 if (tv_mode->burst_ena)
1066 color_conversion = &sdtv_csc_yprpb;
1067 else
1068 color_conversion = &hdtv_csc_yprpb;
1069 burst_ena = false;
1070 break;
1071 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_SVIDEO:
1072 tv_ctl |= TV_ENC_OUTPUT_SVIDEO;
1073 video_levels = tv_mode->svideo_levels;
1074 color_conversion = tv_mode->svideo_color;
1075 burst_ena = tv_mode->burst_ena;
1076 break;
1077 }
1078
1079 if (intel_crtc->pipe == 1)
1080 tv_ctl |= TV_ENC_PIPEB_SELECT;
1081 tv_ctl |= tv_mode->oversample;
1082
1083 if (tv_mode->progressive)
1084 tv_ctl |= TV_PROGRESSIVE;
1085 if (tv_mode->trilevel_sync)
1086 tv_ctl |= TV_TRILEVEL_SYNC;
1087 if (tv_mode->pal_burst)
1088 tv_ctl |= TV_PAL_BURST;
1089
1090 scctl1 = 0;
1091 if (tv_mode->dda1_inc)
1092 scctl1 |= TV_SC_DDA1_EN;
1093 if (tv_mode->dda2_inc)
1094 scctl1 |= TV_SC_DDA2_EN;
1095 if (tv_mode->dda3_inc)
1096 scctl1 |= TV_SC_DDA3_EN;
1097 scctl1 |= tv_mode->sc_reset;
1098 if (video_levels)
1099 scctl1 |= video_levels->burst << TV_BURST_LEVEL_SHIFT;
1100 scctl1 |= tv_mode->dda1_inc << TV_SCDDA1_INC_SHIFT;
1101
1102 scctl2 = tv_mode->dda2_size << TV_SCDDA2_SIZE_SHIFT |
1103 tv_mode->dda2_inc << TV_SCDDA2_INC_SHIFT;
1104
1105 scctl3 = tv_mode->dda3_size << TV_SCDDA3_SIZE_SHIFT |
1106 tv_mode->dda3_inc << TV_SCDDA3_INC_SHIFT;
1107
1108 /* Enable two fixes for the chips that need them. */
1109 if (IS_I915GM(dev))
1110 tv_ctl |= TV_ENC_C0_FIX | TV_ENC_SDP_FIX;
1111
1112 set_tv_mode_timings(dev_priv, tv_mode, burst_ena);
1113
1114 I915_WRITE(TV_SC_CTL_1, scctl1);
1115 I915_WRITE(TV_SC_CTL_2, scctl2);
1116 I915_WRITE(TV_SC_CTL_3, scctl3);
1117
1118 set_color_conversion(dev_priv, color_conversion);
1119
1120 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 4)
1121 I915_WRITE(TV_CLR_KNOBS, 0x00404000);
1122 else
1123 I915_WRITE(TV_CLR_KNOBS, 0x00606000);
1124
1125 if (video_levels)
1126 I915_WRITE(TV_CLR_LEVEL,
1127 ((video_levels->black << TV_BLACK_LEVEL_SHIFT) |
1128 (video_levels->blank << TV_BLANK_LEVEL_SHIFT)));
1129
1130 assert_pipe_disabled(dev_priv, intel_crtc->pipe);
1131
1132 /* Filter ctl must be set before TV_WIN_SIZE */
1133 I915_WRITE(TV_FILTER_CTL_1, TV_AUTO_SCALE);
1134 xsize = tv_mode->hblank_start - tv_mode->hblank_end;
1135 if (tv_mode->progressive)
1136 ysize = tv_mode->nbr_end + 1;
1137 else
1138 ysize = 2*tv_mode->nbr_end + 1;
1139
1140 xpos += intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_LEFT];
1141 ypos += intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_TOP];
1142 xsize -= (intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_LEFT] +
1143 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_RIGHT]);
1144 ysize -= (intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_TOP] +
1145 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_BOTTOM]);
1146 I915_WRITE(TV_WIN_POS, (xpos<<16)|ypos);
1147 I915_WRITE(TV_WIN_SIZE, (xsize<<16)|ysize);
1148
1149 j = 0;
1150 for (i = 0; i < 60; i++)
1151 I915_WRITE(TV_H_LUMA(i), tv_mode->filter_table[j++]);
1152 for (i = 0; i < 60; i++)
1153 I915_WRITE(TV_H_CHROMA(i), tv_mode->filter_table[j++]);
1154 for (i = 0; i < 43; i++)
1155 I915_WRITE(TV_V_LUMA(i), tv_mode->filter_table[j++]);
1156 for (i = 0; i < 43; i++)
1157 I915_WRITE(TV_V_CHROMA(i), tv_mode->filter_table[j++]);
1158 I915_WRITE(TV_DAC, I915_READ(TV_DAC) & TV_DAC_SAVE);
1159 I915_WRITE(TV_CTL, tv_ctl);
1160}
1161
1162static const struct drm_display_mode reported_modes[] = {
1163 {
1164 .name = "NTSC 480i",
1165 .clock = 107520,
1166 .hdisplay = 1280,
1167 .hsync_start = 1368,
1168 .hsync_end = 1496,
1169 .htotal = 1712,
1170
1171 .vdisplay = 1024,
1172 .vsync_start = 1027,
1173 .vsync_end = 1034,
1174 .vtotal = 1104,
1175 .type = DRM_MODE_TYPE_DRIVER,
1176 },
1177};
1178
1179/**
1180 * Detects TV presence by checking for load.
1181 *
1182 * Requires that the current pipe's DPLL is active.
1183
1184 * \return true if TV is connected.
1185 * \return false if TV is disconnected.
1186 */
1187static int
1188intel_tv_detect_type(struct intel_tv *intel_tv,
1189 struct drm_connector *connector)
1190{
1191 struct drm_encoder *encoder = &intel_tv->base.base;
1192 struct drm_crtc *crtc = encoder->crtc;
1193 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
1194 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
1195 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1196 u32 tv_ctl, save_tv_ctl;
1197 u32 tv_dac, save_tv_dac;
1198 int type;
1199
1200 /* Disable TV interrupts around load detect or we'll recurse */
1201 if (connector->polled & DRM_CONNECTOR_POLL_HPD) {
1202 spin_lock_irq(&dev_priv->irq_lock);
1203 i915_disable_pipestat(dev_priv, 0,
1204 PIPE_HOTPLUG_INTERRUPT_STATUS |
1205 PIPE_HOTPLUG_TV_INTERRUPT_STATUS);
1206 spin_unlock_irq(&dev_priv->irq_lock);
1207 }
1208
1209 save_tv_dac = tv_dac = I915_READ(TV_DAC);
1210 save_tv_ctl = tv_ctl = I915_READ(TV_CTL);
1211
1212 /* Poll for TV detection */
1213 tv_ctl &= ~(TV_ENC_ENABLE | TV_TEST_MODE_MASK);
1214 tv_ctl |= TV_TEST_MODE_MONITOR_DETECT;
1215 if (intel_crtc->pipe == 1)
1216 tv_ctl |= TV_ENC_PIPEB_SELECT;
1217 else
1218 tv_ctl &= ~TV_ENC_PIPEB_SELECT;
1219
1220 tv_dac &= ~(TVDAC_SENSE_MASK | DAC_A_MASK | DAC_B_MASK | DAC_C_MASK);
1221 tv_dac |= (TVDAC_STATE_CHG_EN |
1222 TVDAC_A_SENSE_CTL |
1223 TVDAC_B_SENSE_CTL |
1224 TVDAC_C_SENSE_CTL |
1225 DAC_CTL_OVERRIDE |
1226 DAC_A_0_7_V |
1227 DAC_B_0_7_V |
1228 DAC_C_0_7_V);
1229
1230
1231 /*
1232 * The TV sense state should be cleared to zero on cantiga platform. Otherwise
1233 * the TV is misdetected. This is hardware requirement.
1234 */
1235 if (IS_GM45(dev))
1236 tv_dac &= ~(TVDAC_STATE_CHG_EN | TVDAC_A_SENSE_CTL |
1237 TVDAC_B_SENSE_CTL | TVDAC_C_SENSE_CTL);
1238
1239 I915_WRITE(TV_CTL, tv_ctl);
1240 I915_WRITE(TV_DAC, tv_dac);
1241 POSTING_READ(TV_DAC);
1242
1243 intel_wait_for_vblank(intel_tv->base.base.dev,
1244 to_intel_crtc(intel_tv->base.base.crtc)->pipe);
1245
1246 type = -1;
1247 tv_dac = I915_READ(TV_DAC);
1248 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("TV detected: %x, %x\n", tv_ctl, tv_dac);
1249 /*
1250 * A B C
1251 * 0 1 1 Composite
1252 * 1 0 X svideo
1253 * 0 0 0 Component
1254 */
1255 if ((tv_dac & TVDAC_SENSE_MASK) == (TVDAC_B_SENSE | TVDAC_C_SENSE)) {
1256 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Detected Composite TV connection\n");
1257 type = DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_Composite;
1258 } else if ((tv_dac & (TVDAC_A_SENSE|TVDAC_B_SENSE)) == TVDAC_A_SENSE) {
1259 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Detected S-Video TV connection\n");
1260 type = DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_SVIDEO;
1261 } else if ((tv_dac & TVDAC_SENSE_MASK) == 0) {
1262 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Detected Component TV connection\n");
1263 type = DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_Component;
1264 } else {
1265 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Unrecognised TV connection\n");
1266 type = -1;
1267 }
1268
1269 I915_WRITE(TV_DAC, save_tv_dac & ~TVDAC_STATE_CHG_EN);
1270 I915_WRITE(TV_CTL, save_tv_ctl);
1271 POSTING_READ(TV_CTL);
1272
1273 /* For unknown reasons the hw barfs if we don't do this vblank wait. */
1274 intel_wait_for_vblank(intel_tv->base.base.dev,
1275 to_intel_crtc(intel_tv->base.base.crtc)->pipe);
1276
1277 /* Restore interrupt config */
1278 if (connector->polled & DRM_CONNECTOR_POLL_HPD) {
1279 spin_lock_irq(&dev_priv->irq_lock);
1280 i915_enable_pipestat(dev_priv, 0,
1281 PIPE_HOTPLUG_INTERRUPT_STATUS |
1282 PIPE_HOTPLUG_TV_INTERRUPT_STATUS);
1283 spin_unlock_irq(&dev_priv->irq_lock);
1284 }
1285
1286 return type;
1287}
1288
1289/*
1290 * Here we set accurate tv format according to connector type
1291 * i.e Component TV should not be assigned by NTSC or PAL
1292 */
1293static void intel_tv_find_better_format(struct drm_connector *connector)
1294{
1295 struct intel_tv *intel_tv = intel_attached_tv(connector);
1296 const struct tv_mode *tv_mode = intel_tv_mode_find(intel_tv);
1297 int i;
1298
1299 if ((intel_tv->type == DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_Component) ==
1300 tv_mode->component_only)
1301 return;
1302
1303
1304 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(tv_modes); i++) {
1305 tv_mode = tv_modes + i;
1306
1307 if ((intel_tv->type == DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_Component) ==
1308 tv_mode->component_only)
1309 break;
1310 }
1311
1312 intel_tv->tv_format = tv_mode->name;
1313 drm_object_property_set_value(&connector->base,
1314 connector->dev->mode_config.tv_mode_property, i);
1315}
1316
1317/**
1318 * Detect the TV connection.
1319 *
1320 * Currently this always returns CONNECTOR_STATUS_UNKNOWN, as we need to be sure
1321 * we have a pipe programmed in order to probe the TV.
1322 */
1323static enum drm_connector_status
1324intel_tv_detect(struct drm_connector *connector, bool force)
1325{
1326 struct drm_display_mode mode;
1327 struct intel_tv *intel_tv = intel_attached_tv(connector);
1328 enum drm_connector_status status;
1329 int type;
1330
1331 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("[CONNECTOR:%d:%s] force=%d\n",
1332 connector->base.id, connector->name,
1333 force);
1334
1335 mode = reported_modes[0];
1336
1337 if (force) {
1338 struct intel_load_detect_pipe tmp;
1339 struct drm_modeset_acquire_ctx ctx;
1340
1341 drm_modeset_acquire_init(&ctx, 0);
1342
1343 if (intel_get_load_detect_pipe(connector, &mode, &tmp, &ctx)) {
1344 type = intel_tv_detect_type(intel_tv, connector);
1345 intel_release_load_detect_pipe(connector, &tmp, &ctx);
1346 status = type < 0 ?
1347 connector_status_disconnected :
1348 connector_status_connected;
1349 } else
1350 status = connector_status_unknown;
1351
1352 drm_modeset_drop_locks(&ctx);
1353 drm_modeset_acquire_fini(&ctx);
1354 } else
1355 return connector->status;
1356
1357 if (status != connector_status_connected)
1358 return status;
1359
1360 intel_tv->type = type;
1361 intel_tv_find_better_format(connector);
1362
1363 return connector_status_connected;
1364}
1365
1366static const struct input_res {
1367 const char *name;
1368 int w, h;
1369} input_res_table[] = {
1370 {"640x480", 640, 480},
1371 {"800x600", 800, 600},
1372 {"1024x768", 1024, 768},
1373 {"1280x1024", 1280, 1024},
1374 {"848x480", 848, 480},
1375 {"1280x720", 1280, 720},
1376 {"1920x1080", 1920, 1080},
1377};
1378
1379/*
1380 * Chose preferred mode according to line number of TV format
1381 */
1382static void
1383intel_tv_chose_preferred_modes(struct drm_connector *connector,
1384 struct drm_display_mode *mode_ptr)
1385{
1386 struct intel_tv *intel_tv = intel_attached_tv(connector);
1387 const struct tv_mode *tv_mode = intel_tv_mode_find(intel_tv);
1388
1389 if (tv_mode->nbr_end < 480 && mode_ptr->vdisplay == 480)
1390 mode_ptr->type |= DRM_MODE_TYPE_PREFERRED;
1391 else if (tv_mode->nbr_end > 480) {
1392 if (tv_mode->progressive == true && tv_mode->nbr_end < 720) {
1393 if (mode_ptr->vdisplay == 720)
1394 mode_ptr->type |= DRM_MODE_TYPE_PREFERRED;
1395 } else if (mode_ptr->vdisplay == 1080)
1396 mode_ptr->type |= DRM_MODE_TYPE_PREFERRED;
1397 }
1398}
1399
1400/**
1401 * Stub get_modes function.
1402 *
1403 * This should probably return a set of fixed modes, unless we can figure out
1404 * how to probe modes off of TV connections.
1405 */
1406
1407static int
1408intel_tv_get_modes(struct drm_connector *connector)
1409{
1410 struct drm_display_mode *mode_ptr;
1411 struct intel_tv *intel_tv = intel_attached_tv(connector);
1412 const struct tv_mode *tv_mode = intel_tv_mode_find(intel_tv);
1413 int j, count = 0;
1414 u64 tmp;
1415
1416 for (j = 0; j < ARRAY_SIZE(input_res_table);
1417 j++) {
1418 const struct input_res *input = &input_res_table[j];
1419 unsigned int hactive_s = input->w;
1420 unsigned int vactive_s = input->h;
1421
1422 if (tv_mode->max_srcw && input->w > tv_mode->max_srcw)
1423 continue;
1424
1425 if (input->w > 1024 && (!tv_mode->progressive
1426 && !tv_mode->component_only))
1427 continue;
1428
1429 mode_ptr = drm_mode_create(connector->dev);
1430 if (!mode_ptr)
1431 continue;
1432 strncpy(mode_ptr->name, input->name, DRM_DISPLAY_MODE_LEN);
1433
1434 mode_ptr->hdisplay = hactive_s;
1435 mode_ptr->hsync_start = hactive_s + 1;
1436 mode_ptr->hsync_end = hactive_s + 64;
1437 if (mode_ptr->hsync_end <= mode_ptr->hsync_start)
1438 mode_ptr->hsync_end = mode_ptr->hsync_start + 1;
1439 mode_ptr->htotal = hactive_s + 96;
1440
1441 mode_ptr->vdisplay = vactive_s;
1442 mode_ptr->vsync_start = vactive_s + 1;
1443 mode_ptr->vsync_end = vactive_s + 32;
1444 if (mode_ptr->vsync_end <= mode_ptr->vsync_start)
1445 mode_ptr->vsync_end = mode_ptr->vsync_start + 1;
1446 mode_ptr->vtotal = vactive_s + 33;
1447
1448 tmp = (u64) tv_mode->refresh * mode_ptr->vtotal;
1449 tmp *= mode_ptr->htotal;
1450 tmp = div_u64(tmp, 1000000);
1451 mode_ptr->clock = (int) tmp;
1452
1453 mode_ptr->type = DRM_MODE_TYPE_DRIVER;
1454 intel_tv_chose_preferred_modes(connector, mode_ptr);
1455 drm_mode_probed_add(connector, mode_ptr);
1456 count++;
1457 }
1458
1459 return count;
1460}
1461
1462static void
1463intel_tv_destroy(struct drm_connector *connector)
1464{
1465 drm_connector_cleanup(connector);
1466 kfree(connector);
1467}
1468
1469
1470static int
1471intel_tv_set_property(struct drm_connector *connector, struct drm_property *property,
1472 uint64_t val)
1473{
1474 struct drm_device *dev = connector->dev;
1475 struct intel_tv *intel_tv = intel_attached_tv(connector);
1476 struct drm_crtc *crtc = intel_tv->base.base.crtc;
1477 int ret = 0;
1478 bool changed = false;
1479
1480 ret = drm_object_property_set_value(&connector->base, property, val);
1481 if (ret < 0)
1482 goto out;
1483
1484 if (property == dev->mode_config.tv_left_margin_property &&
1485 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_LEFT] != val) {
1486 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_LEFT] = val;
1487 changed = true;
1488 } else if (property == dev->mode_config.tv_right_margin_property &&
1489 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_RIGHT] != val) {
1490 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_RIGHT] = val;
1491 changed = true;
1492 } else if (property == dev->mode_config.tv_top_margin_property &&
1493 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_TOP] != val) {
1494 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_TOP] = val;
1495 changed = true;
1496 } else if (property == dev->mode_config.tv_bottom_margin_property &&
1497 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_BOTTOM] != val) {
1498 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_BOTTOM] = val;
1499 changed = true;
1500 } else if (property == dev->mode_config.tv_mode_property) {
1501 if (val >= ARRAY_SIZE(tv_modes)) {
1502 ret = -EINVAL;
1503 goto out;
1504 }
1505 if (!strcmp(intel_tv->tv_format, tv_modes[val].name))
1506 goto out;
1507
1508 intel_tv->tv_format = tv_modes[val].name;
1509 changed = true;
1510 } else {
1511 ret = -EINVAL;
1512 goto out;
1513 }
1514
1515 if (changed && crtc)
1516 intel_crtc_restore_mode(crtc);
1517out:
1518 return ret;
1519}
1520
1521static const struct drm_connector_funcs intel_tv_connector_funcs = {
1522 .dpms = drm_atomic_helper_connector_dpms,
1523 .detect = intel_tv_detect,
1524 .destroy = intel_tv_destroy,
1525 .set_property = intel_tv_set_property,
1526 .atomic_get_property = intel_connector_atomic_get_property,
1527 .fill_modes = drm_helper_probe_single_connector_modes,
1528 .atomic_destroy_state = drm_atomic_helper_connector_destroy_state,
1529 .atomic_duplicate_state = drm_atomic_helper_connector_duplicate_state,
1530};
1531
1532static const struct drm_connector_helper_funcs intel_tv_connector_helper_funcs = {
1533 .mode_valid = intel_tv_mode_valid,
1534 .get_modes = intel_tv_get_modes,
1535 .best_encoder = intel_best_encoder,
1536};
1537
1538static const struct drm_encoder_funcs intel_tv_enc_funcs = {
1539 .destroy = intel_encoder_destroy,
1540};
1541
1542/*
1543 * Enumerate the child dev array parsed from VBT to check whether
1544 * the integrated TV is present.
1545 * If it is present, return 1.
1546 * If it is not present, return false.
1547 * If no child dev is parsed from VBT, it assumes that the TV is present.
1548 */
1549static int tv_is_present_in_vbt(struct drm_device *dev)
1550{
1551 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1552 union child_device_config *p_child;
1553 int i, ret;
1554
1555 if (!dev_priv->vbt.child_dev_num)
1556 return 1;
1557
1558 ret = 0;
1559 for (i = 0; i < dev_priv->vbt.child_dev_num; i++) {
1560 p_child = dev_priv->vbt.child_dev + i;
1561 /*
1562 * If the device type is not TV, continue.
1563 */
1564 switch (p_child->old.device_type) {
1565 case DEVICE_TYPE_INT_TV:
1566 case DEVICE_TYPE_TV:
1567 case DEVICE_TYPE_TV_SVIDEO_COMPOSITE:
1568 break;
1569 default:
1570 continue;
1571 }
1572 /* Only when the addin_offset is non-zero, it is regarded
1573 * as present.
1574 */
1575 if (p_child->old.addin_offset) {
1576 ret = 1;
1577 break;
1578 }
1579 }
1580 return ret;
1581}
1582
1583void
1584intel_tv_init(struct drm_device *dev)
1585{
1586 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1587 struct drm_connector *connector;
1588 struct intel_tv *intel_tv;
1589 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder;
1590 struct intel_connector *intel_connector;
1591 u32 tv_dac_on, tv_dac_off, save_tv_dac;
1592 const char *tv_format_names[ARRAY_SIZE(tv_modes)];
1593 int i, initial_mode = 0;
1594
1595 if ((I915_READ(TV_CTL) & TV_FUSE_STATE_MASK) == TV_FUSE_STATE_DISABLED)
1596 return;
1597
1598 if (!tv_is_present_in_vbt(dev)) {
1599 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Integrated TV is not present.\n");
1600 return;
1601 }
1602 /* Even if we have an encoder we may not have a connector */
1603 if (!dev_priv->vbt.int_tv_support)
1604 return;
1605
1606 /*
1607 * Sanity check the TV output by checking to see if the
1608 * DAC register holds a value
1609 */
1610 save_tv_dac = I915_READ(TV_DAC);
1611
1612 I915_WRITE(TV_DAC, save_tv_dac | TVDAC_STATE_CHG_EN);
1613 tv_dac_on = I915_READ(TV_DAC);
1614
1615 I915_WRITE(TV_DAC, save_tv_dac & ~TVDAC_STATE_CHG_EN);
1616 tv_dac_off = I915_READ(TV_DAC);
1617
1618 I915_WRITE(TV_DAC, save_tv_dac);
1619
1620 /*
1621 * If the register does not hold the state change enable
1622 * bit, (either as a 0 or a 1), assume it doesn't really
1623 * exist
1624 */
1625 if ((tv_dac_on & TVDAC_STATE_CHG_EN) == 0 ||
1626 (tv_dac_off & TVDAC_STATE_CHG_EN) != 0)
1627 return;
1628
1629 intel_tv = kzalloc(sizeof(*intel_tv), GFP_KERNEL);
1630 if (!intel_tv) {
1631 return;
1632 }
1633
1634 intel_connector = intel_connector_alloc();
1635 if (!intel_connector) {
1636 kfree(intel_tv);
1637 return;
1638 }
1639
1640 intel_encoder = &intel_tv->base;
1641 connector = &intel_connector->base;
1642
1643 /* The documentation, for the older chipsets at least, recommend
1644 * using a polling method rather than hotplug detection for TVs.
1645 * This is because in order to perform the hotplug detection, the PLLs
1646 * for the TV must be kept alive increasing power drain and starving
1647 * bandwidth from other encoders. Notably for instance, it causes
1648 * pipe underruns on Crestline when this encoder is supposedly idle.
1649 *
1650 * More recent chipsets favour HDMI rather than integrated S-Video.
1651 */
1652 intel_connector->polled = DRM_CONNECTOR_POLL_CONNECT;
1653
1654 drm_connector_init(dev, connector, &intel_tv_connector_funcs,
1655 DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_SVIDEO);
1656
1657 drm_encoder_init(dev, &intel_encoder->base, &intel_tv_enc_funcs,
1658 DRM_MODE_ENCODER_TVDAC);
1659
1660 intel_encoder->compute_config = intel_tv_compute_config;
1661 intel_encoder->get_config = intel_tv_get_config;
1662 intel_encoder->pre_enable = intel_tv_pre_enable;
1663 intel_encoder->enable = intel_enable_tv;
1664 intel_encoder->disable = intel_disable_tv;
1665 intel_encoder->get_hw_state = intel_tv_get_hw_state;
1666 intel_connector->get_hw_state = intel_connector_get_hw_state;
1667 intel_connector->unregister = intel_connector_unregister;
1668
1669 intel_connector_attach_encoder(intel_connector, intel_encoder);
1670 intel_encoder->type = INTEL_OUTPUT_TVOUT;
1671 intel_encoder->crtc_mask = (1 << 0) | (1 << 1);
1672 intel_encoder->cloneable = 0;
1673 intel_encoder->base.possible_crtcs = ((1 << 0) | (1 << 1));
1674 intel_tv->type = DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_Unknown;
1675
1676 /* BIOS margin values */
1677 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_LEFT] = 54;
1678 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_TOP] = 36;
1679 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_RIGHT] = 46;
1680 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_BOTTOM] = 37;
1681
1682 intel_tv->tv_format = tv_modes[initial_mode].name;
1683
1684 drm_connector_helper_add(connector, &intel_tv_connector_helper_funcs);
1685 connector->interlace_allowed = false;
1686 connector->doublescan_allowed = false;
1687
1688 /* Create TV properties then attach current values */
1689 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(tv_modes); i++)
1690 tv_format_names[i] = tv_modes[i].name;
1691 drm_mode_create_tv_properties(dev,
1692 ARRAY_SIZE(tv_modes),
1693 tv_format_names);
1694
1695 drm_object_attach_property(&connector->base, dev->mode_config.tv_mode_property,
1696 initial_mode);
1697 drm_object_attach_property(&connector->base,
1698 dev->mode_config.tv_left_margin_property,
1699 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_LEFT]);
1700 drm_object_attach_property(&connector->base,
1701 dev->mode_config.tv_top_margin_property,
1702 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_TOP]);
1703 drm_object_attach_property(&connector->base,
1704 dev->mode_config.tv_right_margin_property,
1705 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_RIGHT]);
1706 drm_object_attach_property(&connector->base,
1707 dev->mode_config.tv_bottom_margin_property,
1708 intel_tv->margin[TV_MARGIN_BOTTOM]);
1709 drm_connector_register(connector);
1710}
